title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
A Senate panel advanced Powell's nomination for a second term leading the Fed, along with three others for top posts at the central bank.

Americans increased retail spending in February, though at a slower pace than at the start of the year.

Walmart wants to hire tens of thousands of workers by the end of April as the company pushes to expand its retail and other businesses.

Howard Schultz is returning to lead Starbucks for a third time, saying the coffee chain needs to reinvent itself once more.

Sycamore and Hudson's Bay plan to submit bids for Kohl's that could value it at more than $9 billion.

Tech shares led a rebound in Chinese stocks as investors seized on supportive comments from top Chinese economic policy makers.

EQT AB struck a $7.5 billion cash-and-stock deal to buy rival private-equity firm Baring Private Equity Asia.

Former CNN anchor Chris Cuomo is seeking at least $125 million from his old employer over his firing.

What's News: Business & Finance
